sen.j: 吉田 兼右（よしだ かねみぎ、永正13年4月20日 (旧暦)（1516年5月21日） - 元亀4年1月10日 (旧暦)（1573年2月12日））は、堂上家（家格は半家 (公家)、卜部氏）である吉田家の8代当主。
sen.e: Kanemigi YOSHIDA (May 21, 1516-February 12, 1573) was the eighth head of the YOSHIDA family, which was a "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks) (its social standing was hanke (court noble), the Urabe clan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kanemigi YOSHIDA (May 21, 1516-February 12, 1573) was the eighth head of the YOSHIDA family, a "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks - its social standing was hanke (court noble), the Urabe clan).

Kanemigi YOSHIDA (May 31, 1516-February 22, 1573) was the eighth head of the YOSHIDA family, a "Tosho-ke" (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks - its social standing was hanke (court noble), the Urabe clan).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.e: He was also the 24th family head of the Urabe clans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He was also the 24th family head of the Urabe clan.
He was also the 24th family head of the Urabe clan.

sen.j: 有職故実書籍『官職難儀』・神道書籍『兼右卿記』の著作者。
sen.e: He was the author of a Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) book "Kanshokunangi" and a Shintoism book "Kanemigikyoki.
He was the author of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) book "Kanshokunangi" and a Shintoism book "Kanemigikyoki.
He was the author of Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) book "Kanshokunangi" and a Shintoism book "Kanemigikyoki."
Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 実は、少納言（非参議正三位）・清原宣賢（別名：船橋宣賢、非参議・吉田兼倶の三男）の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of his biological father, a lesser councilor of state (Hisangi (advisor at large) Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)), Nobukata KIYOHARA (as known as Nobukata FUNABASHI, the third son of Hisangi Kanetomo YOSHIDA).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He was the second son of his biological father, a lesser councilor of state (Hisangi - advisor at large - Shosanmi or Senior Third Rank), Nobukata KIYOHARA (known as Nobukata FUNABASHI, the third son of Hisangi Kanetomo YOSHIDA).

He was the second son of his biological father, a lesser councilor of state (Hisangi - advisor at large - Shosanmi or Senior Third Rank), Nobukata KIYOHARA (known as Nobukata FUNABASHI, the third son of Hisangi Kanetomo YOSHIDA).

sen.j: 実子が無く断絶した、神祇大副兼侍従・吉田兼満の養子となった。
sen.e: He was adopted to Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and chamberlain, Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who had biological child to inherit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He was adopted by Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and chamberlain, Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who had biological child to inherit.
He was adopted by Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and chamberlain, Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who had biological no child to inherit.
sen.cmt: childの前にnoを挿入しました。

sen.j: 神祇大副兼左衛門督・吉田兼見や、神龍院梵舜の父。
sen.e: He was the father of Kanemi YOSHIDA, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards), and Shinryuin Bonshun.
He was the father of Kanemi YOSHIDA, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards), and Shinryuin Bonshun.
He was the father of Kanemi YOSHIDA, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards), and Shinryuin Bonshun.

sen.j: 官途は、侍従・神祇大副兼右兵衛督・従二位。
sen.e: He had served the government as a chamberlain, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto)-cum-Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) and a Junii (Junior Second Rank).

He served the government as a chamberlain, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto)-cum-Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) and a Junii (Junior Second Rank).

He served the government as a chamberlain, Jingi taifu (Senior Assistant Head of the Department of Shinto)-cum-Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) and a Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 吉田家の当主だった吉田兼満が大永5年（1525年）突然家を出奔したため、従弟にあたる兼右が10歳の若さで後を継ぐ。
sen.e: Because Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who was the family head of the Yoshida suddenly run away in 1525, his cousin Kanemigi succeeded to the family at age ten.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Because Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who was the family head of the Yoshida suddenly ran away in 1525, his cousin Kanemigi succeeded to the family at age ten.
Because Kanemitsu YOSHIDA who was the family head of the Yoshida suddenly ran away in 1525, his cousin Kanemigi succeeded to the family at the young age of ten.
sen.cmt: age tenをthe young age of tenに変更しました。

sen.j: 父宣賢が後見役となって唯一神道の道統を継承した。
sen.e: Kanemigi's father Nobukata became his conservator, and Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) was succeeded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kanemigi's father Nobukata became his conservator, and Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) was succeeded.
Kanemigi's father Nobukata became his conservator, and Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) was succeeded.

sen.j: 祖父兼倶以来の神道説を宣揚して、積極的に全国の神社・神職に対して宗源宣旨や神道裁許状を発行する。
sen.e: He actively promoted Shintoism thought founded by his grandfather Kanetomo; he issued sogen senji (decrees of foundations and origins) and Shinto saikyojo (license proof for a Shinto priest) to shrines and Shinto priests of nationwide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He actively promoted Shintoism thought founded by his grandfather Kanetomo; he issued sogen senji (decrees of foundations and origins) and Shinto saikyojo (license proof for a Shinto priest) to shrines and Shinto priests nationwide.

He actively promoted Shintoism thought founded by his grandfather Kanetomo; he issued sogen senji (decrees of foundations and origins) and Shinto saikyojo (license proof for a Shinto priest) to shrines and Shinto priests nationwide.

sen.j: それとともに、地方のオトナ衆・氏子との交流を図って吉田家の家門拡大に努めた。
sen.e: At the same time, he had socialized with otona (village leaders) and parishioners in rural areas to spread the Yoshida's.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At the same time, he had socialized with otona (village leaders) and parishioners in rural areas to spread the Yoshida's.
At the same time, he had socialized with otona (village leaders) and parishioners in rural areas to spread the Yoshida's.

sen.j: 特に周防の大内氏・越前の朝倉氏・若狭武田氏に招かれ神道伝授を行った。
sen.e: Above all, Ouchi clan in Suo and the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Echizen invited him to initiate Shintoism.
Above all, the Ouchi clan in Suo and the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Echizen invited him to initiate Shintoism.
Above all, the Ouchi clan in Suo and the Wakasa-Takeda clan in Echizen invited him to initiate Shintoism.

sen.j: 元亀4年正月10日、58歳で没した。
sen.e: He deceased at the age of 58 in 1573.
He died at the age of 58 in 1573.
He died at the age of 58 in February 22, 1573.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 彼の遺骸は遺言により、吉田神社の近くに社壇を建てて唯神霊神と称して祀られた。
sen.e: According to the will, shadan (a small shrine) was built near Yoshida-jinja Shrine and he had been deified as Yuishin reishin.
According to his will, shadan (a small shrine) was built near Yoshida-jinja Shrine and he had been deified as Yuishin reishin.
According to his will, shadan (a small shrine) was built near Yoshida-jinja Shrine and he had been deified as Yuishin reishin.
